What we love

items.title: Tested: UGREEN’s foldable Qi2.2 25W 3-in-1 charging station – MagSafe wireless charger with a pop-out Apple Watch puck [Deal]
items.summary:
UGREEN was among the first to roll out its Qi2.2 25W chargers, joining brands like Anker and ESR in bringing the new standard to market. We’ve already tested its Qi2 25W 2-in-1 MagSafe charger and its 10,000mAh MagSafe power bank, and now, we’re taking a closer look at the MagFlow 3-in-1 Qi2.2 25W MagSafe wireless charging station. This has now become my go-to bedside charging station to power my iPhone, Apple Watch, and AirPods. I’ve been using it on my nightstand for the past couple of weeks, and here’s a detailed look at how it’s held up.

items.title: New 120W Baseus charger powers six devices at once at $30 low, but here’s how to get one for FREE
items.summary:
Over at Amazon, you’ll find the official Baseus storefront offering its 120W 6-port charging station for $29.99 shipped. Don’t forget to enter promo code 8YNI776K during checkout to see the discounted price. This new model recently hit the scene carrying a $50 price tag. It dropped to $40 shortly after its debut, but today’s deal shaves an additional $10 off to mark a new best price to beat. Alternatively, you can even get this 6-port charger for FREE when you buy the brand’s 140W 5-in-1 Nomos charging station with a Qi2-certified wireless charger. Simply head to this link right here and add both the 140W and 120W units from the “Qualifying” and “Benefit” sections to your cart and checkout. This charging unit is good to have on our desk for powering multiple devices simultaneously, and you can learn more about it in detail below.

You’ll find the 4.9-foot model down at $79.99 shipped, while its larger 9.8-foot model is going for $179.99 shipped and its 14.8-foot model drops to $339.99 shipped, after clipping the on-page coupon. These models usually fetch $150, $260, and $400 at full price, respectively, with discounts being more frequent on the former two, while this is a rarer discount on the latter. You’re saving up to 47% here while these deals last, cutting $70/$80/$60 off the going rates for the best prices we have tracked. You can also shop more of the brand’s smart lighting devices – both for indoors and outdoors – by browsing through the brand’s official storefront here.

Tenways is offering a special extra battery promotion (known as the Tenways Power Bank here) on its AGO X All-Terrain e-bike at $1,999 shipped that also comes with $307 in FREE additional add-on gear, while also offering a 50% discount on the standalone power bank, were you wanting to pick one up for any other models from the brand you may already have. The AGO X e-bike normally goes for $2,499 without discounts, which we’ve mostly seen taken down to this rate over the year, with some occasional drops lower to $1,899. This is the first bundle with the Tenways Power Bank ($309 value), however, giving you a total of $1,116 savings, which is the biggest deal we’ve tracked to date. Alongside this model, you can also find the CGO600 Pro Lightweight e-bikes with $300 price cuts and $118 in FREE gear, as well as the option for a 50% off Power Bank add-on.

items.title: Giant $850 deal knocks Samsung’s 57-inch Odyssey Neo G9 Mini-LED curved gaming monitor down to its lowest price of the year
items.summary:
We just spotted a deal at Samsung that gets you its Odyssey Neo G9 57-inch Mini-LED curved gaming monitor for $1,449.99 shipped. Originally priced at $2,500, this stunning curved gaming monitor has recently been selling for around $2,300. However, today’s Samsung deal – which includes a $50 upgrade credit – knocks a full $850 off its regular price, bringing it down to one of the lowest prices we’ve seen for this model. This marks the return of the lowest price we’ve seen for this display all year, coming in $50 cheaper than the current discounts at Amazon, Best Buy, and B&H. That extra $50 in savings could easily go toward another accessory for your gaming setup, so be sure to cash in now after getting more details below.

more…
